answers.answer: Hi there!Well, without a clinical evaluation it would be difficult to determine the cause of your discomfort/ pain. Possibilities that may need to be considered include neuro-muscular causes, infections, inflammations such as fasciitis, degenerations, heel pad syndrome, injuries, fractures, dislocations, vascular issues such as POVD, micronutrient deficiencies etc. Without a diagnosis at hand it would be difficult to suggest a management plan. I would suggest getting this by an orthopedician for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate management.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: Foot, ankle pain for years.  Late in day can migrate to calf and thigh.  Years in orthotics of all types, work with a very capable DO on back and orthotics.  He works with entire body, has raised my left shoe 9/16th inch.  This has helped somewhat, but I still have burning pain on bottom and top of feet entire day and night.  No diabetes, have taken megavitamins, etc.  Considering microsurgery in hopes of opening tarsal? tunnel.  Is this a reasonable option.
title: Mr. Steve Weger
